edit.title: Mon compte
edit.updated: Les informations ont été mises à jour.

signatureCheck.title: Welcome to the Tezos DigiSign verification page.
signatureCheck.subtitle: You can here check the authenticity of documents signed using the Tezos DigiSign protocol and tools.
signatureCheck.text1: We invite you to drag and drop or upload the file you want to check. If this file has been signed by Sword Group or by a Sword Group partners who informed us of their signatures, and if this file has not been modified since its signature, we will confirm you immediately its authenticity.
signatureCheck.text2: If our platform does not recognize the file, but if you know the file has been certified using Tezos DigiSign, you should have been given a proof document. This document, in the JSON format, will give us all the information we need to check the document authenticity. In such case, we invite you to upload both the file to check and the proof document before you click on the check button.
signatureCheck.drop: Drop file here to upload or browse

hash_not_present.title: Document hash not found in TEZOS DigiSign
hash_not_present.message: We are sorry, we do not recognize this document. Are your sure this document is in the exact same version that the one that has been signed? If not, please upload the original version. If the document is good and if you have been given a proof file, please upload it too.

hash_inconsistent.title: Proof file doesn’t match the document
hash_inconsistent.message: We are sorry, the proof file you provided does not correspond to the document you want to check (hash of the document <hash code> vs hash code of the proof file <>). We invite you to upload the correct proof file. If you do not have another proof file, the document you want to confirm may have been modified since its signature. We invite you in such case to find its original version and try again.

incorrect_root_hash.title: Proof file doesn’t match the document
incorrect_root_hash.message: We are sorry, the proof file you provided includes error in the way its Merkel Tree has been calculated. Are you sure this proof file has been generated by a tool respecting the Tezos DigiSign protocol?

unknown_root_hash.title: Document not timestamped in Tezos Blockchain
unknown_root_hash.message: We are sorry, your proof file corresponds to the document you want to check and looks legitimate. However, we cannot find in the blockchain a proof of its signature. The root hash of the mentioned Merkle Tree ({0}) is not present in the blockchain)

transaction_not_deep_enough.title: Proof file is consistent but the signature is being anchored in the blochain.
transaction_not_deep_enough.message: The proof file you provided is a valid Tezos DigiSign V0 proof. the signature is being anchored in the blockchain. Please wait a bit the completion of the anchorage

generic.title: Document hash not found in TEZOS DigiSign
generic.message: We are sorry, we do not recognize this document. Are your sure this document is in the exact same version that the one that has been signed? If not, please upload the original version. If the document is good and if you have been given a proof file, please upload it too.

block1.title: Your file is certified.
block1.message: It has been signed by {0} on the {1}

block2.line2: Using the {0} algorithm, your file generates the below digital print (hash) : {1}
block2.line3: The signature process may have included additional documents at the same time. We used a system knows as Merkel Tree to generate a single signature on multiple documents simultaneously. This Merkel Tree is identified by its Root Hash {0}.
block2.line4: Your document, along with the Root Hash, has been signed in the Tezos Blockchain transaction {0}, present in the Tezos block  {1}, the {2}. It is now stored in a smart contract
block2.line5: The document has been signed by an entity knows by its unique Tezos Public key {0}. The operator of this verification platform received beforehand confirmation that his public key is owned by {1}.
block2.line6: Click {link} to get a proof file explaining the relationship between your document digital print and the Merkle tree root hash. With this proof file you can prove to anyone that your document has been signed and timestamped. If you do not have it already, please keep it in a safe place along with your original document.
block2.line7: Click {link} to get the technical information on where the information is stored in the Tezos DigiSign smart contract (contract address: {0}).

block1.title: Your file is certified.
block1.message: It has been signed by {0} on the {1}

block2.line1: Using the <algorithm> algorithm, your file generates the below digital print (hash) : {0}
block2.line2: The signature process may have included additional documents at the same time. A system knows as Merkel Tree has been used to generate a single signature on multiple documents simultaneously. This Merkel Tree is identified by its Root Hash {0}.
block2.line3: The cryptographic proof that your file is part of this Merkle tree has been obtained by respecting the information present in the proof file:
block2.line4: We calculated and confirmed your document hash: <hash>
block2.line5: We took the previous result, and added by concatenation on its <righ/left> another hash: <hash list>
block2.line6: This last result is on the top of the Merkle Tree. We call it the Merkle Tree Root Hash:  <Root Hash>>
block2.line7: If your document was different in any way from the one that has been signed, the Root Hash would be different
block2.line8: We then have been into the blockchain, and we can confirm that your document along with the Root Hash, has been signed in the Tezos Blockchain transaction <transaction id>, present in the Tezos block  <block id>, the <DD/MM/YYYY HH:MI:SS>. It is now stored in a smart contract.
block2.line9: The document has been signed by an entity knows by its unique Tezos Public key <hash code of the signer public key>. Based on our internal database, thee operator of this verification platform received beforehand confirmation that his public key is owned by <name of the signer>
block2.line10: Click here [<URL> in link] to get the technical information on where the information is stored in the Tezos DigiSign smart contract (contract address: <contract_id>).

info.title: For your understanding, here is a brief description of the different steps of the verification process.

col1.title: With document only:
col1.step1: Compute the SHA256 hash of the document
col1.step2: Check that document hash is stored in Tezos DigiSign verification database
col1.step3: Retrieve the transaction containing the document hash and the Merkle tree root hash associated
col1.step4: Check that the Merkle tree root hash is stored in the Tezos DigiSign Smart Contract

col2.title: With document and proof file:
col2.step1: Compute the SHA256 hash of the document
col2.step2: Check that document hash matches the hash_document value in the proof file
col2.step3: Compute the Merkle tree root hash with the hash_list data in the proof file
col2.step4: Check that the document Merkle tree root hash matches the hash_root value in the proof file
col2.step5: Check that the hash_document value is stored in Tezos DigiSign verification database
col2.step6: Check that the hash_root value is stored in Tezos DigiSign verification database
col2.step7: Check that the hash_root value is stored in the Tezos DigiSign Smart Contract

login.invalid: Erreur sur votre login et/ou mot de passe.
login.disabled:
Vous ne pouvez pas vous connecter car votre compte a été désactivé.
Pour plus d'informations, veuillez contacter votre administrateur.
login.default: Connexion impossible, veuillez contacter votre administrateur.

password.differents: Les mots de passe doivent être identiques.
password.weak: Le mot de passe doit contenir au moins 8 caractères, 1 majuscule, 1 minuscule, 1 nombre et 1 caractère spécial.

back.generic: Les informations n'ont pas pu être mises à jour, veuillez contacter votre administrateur.
